item.title: Introduction to Gnosticism
item.description: Gnosticism is a term that refers to a diverse set of religious movements that flourished in the early centuries of the Common Era, particularly in the Mediterranean world. At its core, Gnosticism is characterized by the belief that knowledge (gnosis in Greek) is the key to achieving salvation.
